instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good‚Äù and is required for the machine to power on & post..
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.S5_PWRGD: What is S5_PWRGD? The S5_PWRGD signal is a status signal that indicates the S5 rails are on and functioning properly. If this is not present, check the S5 rails to see if they are functioning, and the chip that creates S5_PWRGD..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL>  "chicken or the egg"
threads.message:
I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that is just sitting there 0.025A  Not enabling 3v3 SUS and turning on the BIOS.

I noticed that <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is not present at <RESISTOR>R1451</RESISTOR>.
This is generated by the SMC.   Isn't this required to enable <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>?

Tried forcing it with a 10k and 1k resistor but it gets pulled down.
40 k ohm resistance to ground

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL>  "chicken or the egg"
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL>  "chicken or the egg"
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R8141</RESISTOR> was high resistance.

You sir are a
[URL='https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/steely-eyed_missile_man#:~:text=steely%2Deyed%20missile%20man%20(plural,problem%20while%20under%20extreme%20pressure.'][SIZE=5][B]steely-eyed missile man[/B][/SIZE][/URL]
 
I have never troubleshot this area.   There was water damage around <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> however a physical poke and scrape check of <RESISTOR>R8141</RESISTOR> appeared that the resistor was good so I moved on.   Just goes to show you never know!
